alert.note: Alert for Maryland Beaches (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 01 at 2:42PM EDT until September 02 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and large battering waves expected. * WHERE...The Maryland Beaches of Worcester County. In Virginia, Accomack County. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. OCEAN CITY INLET MD MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.0 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.5 FT, MAJOR 3.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 01/10 PM 3.7 1.2 0.7 1 NONE 02/10 AM 3.5 1.0 0.6 1 NONE 02/11 PM 3.3 0.8 0.4 1 NONE 03/11 AM 3.2 0.7 0.3 1 NONE 04/12 AM 2.9 0.4 0.2 1 NONE 04/12 PM 3.1 0.6 0.2 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Shore break occurs when waves break directly on the beach. It is extremely important to protect your head and neck whenever you are in breaking waves by keeping your hands in front of you at all times. Strong longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties and other hazardous areas. In many cases, the longshore current is strong enough to prevent swimmers from being able to keep their feet on the bottom making it difficult to return to shore.
